column4: 6% of all images are uploaded by English-language speaking users.
column10: What are the men doing exactly? Is anything written on the white boards ?
column11: I like that they say how many men, that hte subjects are men, and that they are working together, although I don't quite know how they are working together other than I know white boards and computers are involved.
column12: Not bad per se, but how are the men working together?
column19: What is shown in the picture to explain why one man fell? Does he look hurt? Do the 2 standing men look like they are trying to help or picking their nose?
column20: I like how it tells me that 2 of the "opposing" team members have stopped and not just 2 people are standing by.
column28: Why is there a player on the ground? Why is the focus on the two players? What does this have to do with hair? Are there people in the picture with "hair styles?"
column30: Not enough info to make it relevant to the article intro.
column37: Are there any types of sculptures located in the park, and if yes, what are they?
column38: I like the details that it is a nice day, and the grass seems to be well-watered since it is green, and that it is a park with a pond.
column39: Again, the "bad" is the lack of info.
column46: What does the church seem to be made of? Approximately when might the church have been built?
column56: Flowing river; valley of a mountain; shallow hills; trees
column64: Are there pillows on the couch and chairs? Is the floor wood? Anything hanging from the walls/windows? What colors dominant the design?
column65: I like the detail of the material of the furniture.
column67: This is one of those photos that can have a super long image description. Unless it is important to note for the understanding of the photo, the image description here is fine. But if more detail is needed to understand something important happenign within the photo, then one can get a relatively long image description. So, if the chairs and couch are the important thing ... then, I'm fine with this type of description. I don't necessarily need to know colors, design patterns, what's on the wall and so forth. Unless of course, I was an interior designer. Then this image descriptionis lacking. Image description is an interesting balance of too much or not enough.
column74: I like knowing the material of the furniture
column82: What does the cathedral have to do with the cross? Are there examples of crosses anywhere in the photo?
column84: Gothic style, I don't personally know what that means
column91: I would be interested to know the coloring of the lap top cases since the intro speaks of black and white goods.
column92: I like knowing that they are in a board room, 2 tables pushed together, everyone but one person has a laptop. I like knowing they are smiling. How many women and men. It's even kind of nice knowing there is lush green grass outside the window, although I would say that is info we don't need to know  for the image to be accessible.
column100: Is the mountain covered in foliage? How do we know it is summer or early fall?
column109: The hillsides are populated with what? A city? Trees? flowers? Animals?
column118: I would want to know more about the dishes and learn if the dishes and other table wear, plus potential food, are influenced by a particular culture.
column120: Dishes on a table. LOL See my comments above on how to improve.
column127: What the heck does incapie mean?
column128: The fact that the photo frames the roof telling me that the roof or roofs are central to the article.
column136: Who is playing the guitars? Women? Me? Children? Ethinicity of people playing? Or does it only focus on the hands? Also, are the guitars acoustic or electric?
column145: Unless it is important to know, which I don't think it is, what type of advertisements are being shown in the background?
column154: What type of food is being prepared?
column163: are there other food and drink?
column165: The type of wine, red or white, is left out.
column172: does the window have curtains, sashes, blinds, etc? Also, the closed window is protecting the family from what type of weather? Snow? Rain?
column176: I refer to myself as blind and I use a cane and am a fluent braille reader. I can read some print if it is at my nose, but I can't really "see" what is going on in photos. I cannot recognize faces.
column177: Always (More than 95% of the time you use computers)
column183: I did not like Q4. I have no idea how relevant the description is to the image. Without knowing exactly what the image is in its entirety, I cannot say how relevant the description was. Also, this is waaaaay too long. 19 samples could have easily been 10.
